get.description:
Health check endpoint for load balancers and monitoring.

Returns:
    Status dictionary indicating service availability.

Return current authenticated user information.

Returns:
    UserInfo with user ID, email, organization ID and name.

Raises:
    HTTPException: 500 if unable to fetch user information.

post.description:
Upload file content for a pragma/file resource.

The file is stored in GCS and can be referenced by a pragma/file resource.
After uploading, apply the resource YAML to make it available:

```yaml
provider: pragma
resource: file
name: my-file
config:
  content_type: application/pdf
lifecycle_state: pending
```

Returns:
    FileMetadata with URL, size, checksum, and upload timestamp.

Raises:
    HTTPException: 413 if file exceeds maximum size.

get.description:
Get a signed URL for file download.

Returns a time-limited URL that can be used to download the file without
authentication. The URL expires after 15 minutes.

Returns:
    SignedUrlResponse with signed URL and expiration time.

Raises:
    HTTPException: 404 if file not found.

Download file content.

Supports two authentication modes:
- Bearer token: Standard authenticated request
- Signed URL: Include token and expires query parameters

Returns:
    File content with appropriate content-type header.

Raises:
    HTTPException: 401 if authentication fails.
    HTTPException: 404 if file not found.

delete.description:
Delete file content from storage.

This only deletes the file content. The pragma/file resource must be
deleted separately using the resources API.

Idempotent: Returns 204 even if file doesn't exist.

head.description:
Check if file exists.

Returns:
    200 with metadata headers if exists, 404 if not.

Raises:
    HTTPException: 404 if file not found.

get.description:
Download file content for internal cluster use.

This endpoint is for provider access to files. It uses tenant_id from
the URL path instead of JWT authentication.

Only accessible from within the Kubernetes cluster - not exposed via
public ingress.

Args:
    tenant_id: Tenant/organization ID owning the file.
    name: File name.

Returns:
    File content with content-type from stored metadata.

Raises:
    HTTPException: 404 if file not found.

List all failed events for the authenticated tenant.

Returns events that failed processing after exhausting retries.
Use this endpoint to investigate failures and retry or delete events.

Returns:
    List of failed events, optionally filtered by provider.

delete.description:
Bulk delete failed events.

Requires either `?all=true` to delete all events or `?provider=x` to delete
events for a specific provider.

Returns:
    Dictionary with count of deleted events.

Raises:
    HTTPException: 400 if neither `all=true` nor `provider` specified.

schema.title: Response Ops-Bulk Delete Dead Letter Events

get.description:
Get a single failed event by ID.

Returns:
    Failed event with error details and original payload.

Raises:
    HTTPException: 404 if event not found.

delete.description:
Delete a single failed event.

Permanently removes the event. Idempotent - succeeds even if event doesn't exist.

post.description:
Retry a single failed event.

Requeues the event for processing and removes it from the failed events list.
The event will be processed automatically.

Returns:
    Event queued for processing.

Raises:
    HTTPException: 404 if event not found.

Retry all failed events for the authenticated tenant.

Requeues all failed events for processing and removes them from the
failed events list. Events will be processed automatically.

Returns:
    Dictionary with count of retried events.

schema.title: Response Ops-Retry All Dead Letter Events

get.description:
List all providers for the current tenant.

Returns providers with their deployment status. Providers that have
been pushed but not deployed will have deployment_status=None.

Args:
    service: Provider service for provider operations.

Returns:
    List of ProviderInfo with provider metadata and deployment status.

post.description:
Push provider code and trigger a Cloud Build.

Accepts a tarball containing provider code and triggers a Cloud Build
to create a container image. Returns a CalVer version for tracking.

Args:
    provider_id: Unique identifier for the provider.
    code: Tarball (tar.gz) containing provider source code.
    service: Provider service for build orchestration.

Returns:
    PushResponse with CalVer version and Cloud Build ID for tracking.

Raises:
    HTTPException: 400 if build creation fails.

get.description:
Get the status of a build by version.

Args:
    provider_id: Provider identifier.
    version: CalVer version string (YYYYMMDD.HHMMSS).
    service: Provider service for build operations.

Returns:
    BuildInfo with current build state.

Raises:
    HTTPException: 404 if build not found.

Stream logs from a build.

Returns build logs as a streaming text response for real-time
monitoring of build progress.

Args:
    provider_id: Provider identifier.
    version: CalVer version string (YYYYMMDD.HHMMSS).
    service: Provider service for build operations.

Returns:
    StreamingResponse with build logs.

Raises:
    HTTPException: 404 if build not found, 500 if streaming fails.

Get the deployment status for a provider.

Returns a minimal status without internal K8s details like replica
counts, deployment names, or container images.

Args:
    provider_id: Unique identifier for the provider.
    service: Provider service for deployment operations.

Returns:
    ProviderStatus with status, version, updated_at, and healthy flag.

Raises:
    HTTPException: 404 if deployment not found.

post.description:
Deploy a provider by version.

Deploys the specified version or the latest successful build if no version
is provided. Activates resource schemas from the build during deployment.

Args:
    provider_id: Unique identifier for the provider.
    request: Deploy request with optional version (defaults to latest successful).
    service: Provider service for deployment orchestration.

Returns:
    ProviderStatus with status, version, updated_at, and healthy flag.

Raises:
    HTTPException: 404 if build not found or no successful build exists.
    HTTPException: 400 if specified build is not deployable.
    HTTPException: 500 if deployment fails.

get.description:
List builds for a provider.

Returns the last 10 builds ordered by creation time (newest first).
Excludes internal fields (image URL, cloud build ID).

Args:
    provider_id: Unique identifier for the provider.
    service: Provider service for build operations.

Returns:
    List of BuildInfo for the provider's builds.

Get a specific build by CalVer version.

Syncs build status from Cloud Build and returns the build info.

Args:
    provider_id: Unique identifier for the provider.
    version: CalVer version string (YYYYMMDD.HHMMSS).
    service: Provider service for build operations.

Returns:
    BuildInfo for the requested build.

Raises:
    HTTPException: 404 if build not found.

delete.description:
Delete a provider and all associated data.

Removes the provider deployment, resource definitions, and pending events.
By default, fails if the provider has any resources.
Use cascade=true to delete all resources along with the provider.

Args:
    provider_id: Unique identifier for the provider to delete.
    service: Provider service for deletion orchestration.
    cascade: If true, delete all resources. If false (default), fail if resources exist.

Returns:
    ProviderDeleteResult with cleanup summary.

Raises:
    HTTPException: 409 if provider has resources and cascade=false.
    HTTPException: 500 if deletion fails.

parameters.name: cascade

schema.description: Delete all resources for this provider (default: fail if resources exist)
schema.title: Cascade

parameters.description: Delete all resources for this provider (default: fail if resources exist)

get.description:
List available resource types.

Returns resource types from both the shared namespace (platform resources
like pragma/secret) and the organization namespace (deployed providers).

Returns:
    List of resource types, ordered by provider and resource name.

List all resources.

Returns:
    List of resources matching filters, ordered by name.

Get resource by ID.

Returns:
    Resource with complete configuration and state.

delete.description:
Delete a resource.

Triggers the provider's deletion handler. The resource is set to PENDING state
and will be removed when the provider confirms successful deletion.

Idempotent: Returns 204 if resource doesn't exist (already deleted).

Returns:
    Resource in PENDING state awaiting provider deletion.

Raises:
    HTTPException: 204 if resource already deleted.

get.description:
Get resource lifecycle status.

Returns only the lifecycle state, useful for polling without fetching full configuration.

Lifecycle states:
    - draft: Stored but not submitted for processing
    - pending: Validated and queued for provider
    - processing: Provider is actively processing
    - ready: Successfully provisioned and operational
    - failed: Processing failed (check error field)

Returns:
    ResourceStatus with lifecycle_state and optional error message.

post.description:
Apply a resource with declarative lifecycle semantics.

Set lifecycle_state in the resource:
    - lifecycle_state="draft": Store without processing (default)
    - lifecycle_state="pending": Validate dependencies and queue for processing

Cannot set PROCESSING, READY, FAILED (system-only states).
Cannot modify resources in PENDING or PROCESSING state.

Returns:
    Applied resource with timestamps and server-populated fields.

get.description:
Get logs for a resource.

Proxies log requests to the provider runtime that manages this resource.

Response modes:
    - follow=false (default): Returns a JSON array of LogEntry objects
    - follow=true: Returns an SSE stream of log events

SSE format (when follow=true):
    event: log
    data: {"timestamp": "...", "level": "info", "message": "..."}

Returns:
    List of LogEntry objects (follow=false) or SSE StreamingResponse (follow=true).

Raises:
    HTTPException: 504 on provider timeout, 502 on provider error or connection failure.

parameters.name: since

schema.description: Only return logs after this ISO timestamp
schema.title: Since

parameters.description: Only return logs after this ISO timestamp

parameters.name: tail

schema.description: Number of recent log entries to return
schema.title: Tail

parameters.description: Number of recent log entries to return

parameters.name: follow

schema.description: Stream logs in real-time via SSE
schema.title: Follow

parameters.description: Stream logs in real-time via SSE

200.description: Log entries (JSON array or SSE stream)

text/event-stream.description: SSE stream of log events when follow=true

get.description:
Get health status of a resource.

Proxies the health check to the provider runtime that manages this resource.
The provider calls the resource's health() method and returns the result.

Returns:
    ResourceHealth with status (healthy, unhealthy, degraded) and optional details.

Raises:
    HTTPException: 404 if health check not available, 504 on timeout, 502 on provider error.

BuildInfo.title: BuildInfo
BuildInfo.description:
Build information exposed via API.

Excludes internal fields (image, cloud_build_id) that should not
be exposed to users.

BuildStatus.title: BuildStatus
BuildStatus.description: Status of a BuildKit build job.

DeadLetterEventResponse.title: DeadLetterEventResponse
DeadLetterEventResponse.description:
Failed event response.

Attributes:
    event_id: Original event ID.
    provider: Provider name (e.g., "postgres").
    resource_type: Resource type (e.g., "database").
    resource_name: Resource name from manifest.
    event_type: Type of lifecycle event (CREATE, UPDATE, DELETE).
    payload: Resource configuration as JSON object.
    error_message: Error message from last failed attempt.
    attempt_count: Number of processing attempts before failure.
    failed_at: When event failed.

DeployRequest.title: DeployRequest
DeployRequest.description:
Request to deploy a provider.

If version is omitted, deploys the latest successful build.

EventType.title: EventType
EventType.description: Resource lifecycle event type: CREATE, UPDATE, or DELETE.

OutboxEventResponse.title: OutboxEventResponse
OutboxEventResponse.description:
Event response.

Attributes:
    event_id: Unique identifier for this event.
    provider: Provider name (e.g., "postgres").
    resource_type: Resource type (e.g., "database").
    resource_name: Resource name from manifest.
    event_type: Type of lifecycle event (CREATE, UPDATE, DELETE).
    payload: Resource configuration as JSON object.
    previous_config: Previous configuration for UPDATE events.
    correlation_id: Correlation ID for tracing.
    status: Processing status (pending, published).
    created_at: When event was created.
    published_at: When event was processed.

OutboxStatus.title: OutboxStatus
OutboxStatus.description:
Status of an event.

Attributes:
    PENDING: Event created but not yet processed.
    PUBLISHED: Event successfully processed.

OwnerReference.title: OwnerReference
OwnerReference.description:
Reference to a resource that owns this resource for lifecycle coordination.

Used for cascading deletes and ownership tracking. When an owner resource
is deleted, owned resources can be automatically cleaned up.

A resource can have multiple owners (rare but valid for shared resources).

Attributes:
    provider: Provider that manages the owner resource.
    resource: Resource type name.
    name: Resource instance name.

ProviderDeleteResult.title: ProviderDeleteResult
ProviderDeleteResult.description:
User-facing result of a provider delete operation.

Minimal representation without internal infrastructure details.

Attributes:
    provider_id: Provider that was deleted.
    deployment_deleted: Whether the running deployment was removed.
    resources_deleted: Number of resources deleted (if cascade was used).

ProviderInfo.title: ProviderInfo
ProviderInfo.description:
Provider information exposed via API.

Combines provider metadata with deployment status for listing.

Attributes:
    provider_id: Unique identifier for the provider.
    current_version: CalVer of currently deployed build (None if never deployed).
    deployment_status: Current deployment status (None if not deployed).
    updated_at: Timestamp of last provider update (typically last deployment).

ProviderStatus.title: ProviderStatus
ProviderStatus.description:
User-facing provider deployment status.

Minimal representation without internal K8s details like replica
counts, deployment names, or container images.

Attributes:
    status: Current deployment status.
    version: CalVer version string of deployed build.
    updated_at: Last update timestamp.
    healthy: Whether the provider is healthy (available with ready replicas).

Resource.title: Resource
Resource.description:
Domain model for resources with provider/resource identity and 5-state lifecycle.

Identity fields (frozen - immutable after creation):
    provider: Provider that manages this resource type.
    resource: Resource type name.
    name: Unique resource instance name.

Configuration fields (mutable):
    config: Resource configuration dictionary. May contain embedded resource
        configurations if the provider schema defines fields as resource types.
    dependencies: References to resources this resource depends on.
    owner_references: References to resources that own this resource for
        lifecycle coordination and cascading deletes.

Output fields (provider-managed):
    outputs: Resource outputs from provider processing.
    error: Error message when resource is in FAILED state.

Lifecycle fields (system-managed):
    lifecycle_state: Current state (DRAFT/PENDING/PROCESSING/READY/FAILED).
    pending_event_id: Event ID currently being processed (set on PROCESSING,
        cleared on READY/FAILED). Used for response idempotency validation.
    provisioned: Whether the resource was successfully created at least once.
        Used to distinguish failed creates (retry CREATE) from failed updates
        (retry UPDATE).

Categorization fields (mutable):
    tags: Optional list of tags for categorization and filtering.

Inherited from PragmaModel:
    created_at: Creation timestamp (frozen).
    updated_at: Last update timestamp (mutable).

ResourceDefinition.title: ResourceDefinition
ResourceDefinition.description:
Domain model for resource definitions with provider/resource identity.

Resource definitions describe the schema and configuration for a resource type.
Providers register resource definitions to declare what resources they can manage.

Identity fields (frozen - immutable after creation):
    provider: Provider that manages this resource type.
    resource: Resource type name.

Schema fields (mutable):
    schema: JSON schema defining the resource configuration structure.
    description: Human-readable description of the resource type.

Categorization fields (mutable):
    tags: Optional list of tags for categorization and filtering.

Inherited from PragmaModel:
    created_at: Creation timestamp (frozen).
    updated_at: Last update timestamp (mutable).

ResourceHealth.title: ResourceHealth
ResourceHealth.description:
Health status of a resource reported by its provider.

Attributes:
    status: Health state (healthy, unhealthy, degraded).
    message: Optional human-readable description.
    details: Optional provider-specific health check details.

ResourceReference.title: ResourceReference
ResourceReference.description:
Reference to another resource for dependency tracking.

Used to express dependencies between resources. At commit time,
the API validates that all referenced resources exist and are READY.

Attributes:
    provider: Provider that manages the referenced resource.
    resource: Resource type name.
    name: Resource instance name.

ResourceStatus.title: ResourceStatus
ResourceStatus.description:
Resource lifecycle status response.

Attributes:
    resource_id: Unique resource identifier.
    lifecycle_state: Current lifecycle state (draft, pending, processing, ready, failed).
    error: Error message if resource is in failed state.

SignedUrlResponse.title: SignedUrlResponse
SignedUrlResponse.description: Response containing a signed download URL.

UserInfo.title: UserInfo
UserInfo.description:
User information response model.

Attributes:
    user_id: Unique user identifier.
    email: User's primary email address.
    organization_id: Organization identifier.
    organization_name: Name of the user's organization.
